40378759.review:
This is one of the best games I've ever played!  I was looking for a challenging platformer with simple mechanics, and this game was perfect for that need.

There really is something for everyone in this game, whether you're a casual gamer, a speedrunner, or just like Nintendo-hard games.  The standard levels are great for exploration and have some challenge, but are doable with some practice.  Hidden within those levels are items for opening up the B-side (and eventually C-side) versions of those levels, which have a heightened difficulty and are where I found the true source of fun for this game for myself.

It took me 36 hours to get 100% completion, and I died A LOT.  However, the joy of beating a hard screen or finding a hidden collectable in a level is so satisfying.  It was definitely worth it!  :)

40377454.review:
[h1] Celeste is a masterpiece that should absolutely not be missed. [/h1]

Matt Thorson of Matt Makes Games developed a game called [i]Towerfall Ascension,[/i] a game that I've put 40+ hours into and love to death. I was ecstatic to discover that Matt Makes Games was putting out another game and I am happy to report that I have been blown away by it. It is so easy to see the influences from Towerfall Ascension in Celste and I love seeing how the mechanics and ideas from Towerfall translated over into Celeste. Before I gush too much about Celeste, let's dive into the nitty-gritty details.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[b]+Soundtrack[/b]
These past couple of years have introduced me to some of my favorite video game soundtracks of all time. Titles like Undertale, VA-11 Hall-A, and Nier:Automata blew me away with how much I enjoyed their music. I'm proud to say that Celeste has now joined this list of video game soundtracks that I purchase and will listen to on a regular basis. The soundtrack in celeste has a chill chip-tune vibe to it and yet absolutely knows how to amp up the intensity when it needs to. 

[b]+Story[/b]
Usually these sort of 2D Platforming games I don't go into it expecting much of a story (if one at all). However, Celeste was able to shatter this expectation and deliver a story with lovable characters and with well written dialogue. 

[i](Side note: I love the sound effects that the characters make while their dialogue is being read. Their chrips and squeeks really match the tone and facial expressions of what the character is saying. It's a really nice touch.)[/i] 

I don't want to get too much into the story because I don't want to spoil anything. But I will say the game touches on topics like anxiety and depression and it does so in a very tasteful manner. The game also ties these topics into the gameplay perfectly. As Madeline is trying to overcome these hurdles in her life, so too is the player trying to overcome the challenges and obstacles that the game throws at them. 

[b] +Balanced Difficulty[/b]
I personally find the difficulty in Celeste to be [i]juuuust[/i] right. I love a good challenge, but if a game is overly difficult just for the sake of being diffult, it usually doesn't hold my attention for long. Celeste however, strikes that perfect balance of difficult yet rewarding. Some parts may take quite a few tries, but it's easy to see yourself improve. After completing a level, Celeste shows you your death count for the total number of tries it took to complete that level. I challenge anyone to go back and play a level right after beating it. More often than not you'll be able to cut that death count roughly in half your 2nd time through.

[b]+Assist Mode[/b]
Some people may be turned off a bit by more difficult platformers or may want to just experience the game for its story. I get that, and Celeste gets that. That's why I believe the way Celeste handles Assist Mode is excellent. Mark Brown put out a great video going into more depth about how Celeste handles Assist Mode and I highly encourage anyone reading this to go check it out [url=https://youtu.be/NInNVEHj_G4] here. [/url]

[b]+Strawberries![/b]
Celeste has collectable strawberries hidden throughout each level. Usually these can be found in little side rooms, hidden off the main path. These rooms pose an extra challenge for the player and are completely optional. They are tied into the game so seemlessly and the challenge rooms are designed so well that I feel that I'd be doing the game a disservice by skipping them! 
[i]I've personally gotten 90 strawberries so far, and I plan on going back and getting any I that I've missed ;][/i]

[h1] Cons:[/h1]
[b]-The length of B-Side Levels[/b]
In celeste there are bonus levels that can be unlocked that are harder versions of levels in the main campaign. These levels really amp up the difficulty for players looking for that extra challenge. However, I do feel like some of them go on for too long. Some B-Side levels I'd rack up close to around 700 deaths and would have to Save and Quit to come back to it later just because it was so exhausting. I would have liked for them to be shortened down a bit. However, do keep in mind though that this is a very [i]very[/i] very minor gripe about the game as the B-Side levels are completely optional.

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]
Should you buy Celeste? [b]Absolutely.[/b] The game is a delight and is a game that I replay over and over again. Everything about the game is so lovable. The music, the characters, the art...

The experience will stick with you and it'll leave you begging for more.

40356625.review:
Celeste is a fantastic game.

The controls are tight and responsive. The platforming is challenging and, until you hit the b-sides and extra challenges, feel very fair.

The story is a fairly simple retelling of the hero's journey, but the characters are endearing and they keep your interest for the duration of the game. Some character interactions are optional and you can skip them the get back to the gameplay faster.

It is ultimately the gameplay that keeps Celeste from becoming boring. Levels and sections are built around interesting mechanics that then come back and are iterated upon again, and again in progressively more challenging and clever level designs that feels extremely rewarding to master.

The strawberries, while unnecessary to collect, provide the best present a good game can give; more game to play. 

The B-sides and extra levels crank the challenge to the limit.

Celeste is worth the $20 dollar asking price, you won't be disappointed by it.

Called B and C side these extra 16 levels, makes the campaign feel like an introduction if comparing the diffuculty, like those levels are hard really hard, but they are still fair somehow, after dying 500 times on a level i kept on thinking "ok next level must be bs, they must have ran out of ideas at this point" but no, throughout all of those 16 levels every challenge is still kept fair. 40352514.review:
[h1]山不在高，有仙则名。横版不在多，有突破则灵。[/h1]

我原以为，2018对我来说，平平无奇。（喂！在那件事之后为什么你每个年初都会这么说……）然而我第一个月就预判错了……
[b]这个就是2018的第一个重磅炸弹！[/b]

大家都知道IGN评分吧（至少看这评测的玩家）？这个实际上不是那么靠谱的游戏评分，居然给这个游戏打了10/10的高评价！面对IGN10/10的评分，肯定会有人疑惑：为什么就是这样的游戏都会得到10分？他们真的打过了吗？难道IGN对游戏有什么不为人知的……
停下！虽说IGN的确对独立游戏的评分会稍微高一点，但如果你称Celeste为“这样的游戏”的话……我想你应该没有真正的玩过这个游戏，或者只玩了1关就退了。

我们这里很多玩家是这样的：看画面入手……那些画面逼真或画风优美独特的游戏，销量肯定不低；而像这样的低像素游戏，就很难会让这类玩家产生好感。[b]然而游戏不能只看画面，很多像素游戏的内容比画面还要重要。[/b]

所以，这个游戏的商店页面的视频截图仅供参考，但绝对不能只看截图视频，或者只玩了最初的关卡后断言。毕竟，Celeste整个游戏就像漂浮在海上的巨大冰山一样，画面和玩法只是露在水面上的那一角，实际游戏质量就像隐藏在水下的整体一样，需要玩家花点时间细细品味。


[h1]但光这么说也不能让看评测的人看出这座山为什么厉害啊，那么我来详细地说这山到底有什么厉害之处。[/h1]

[b]操作易上手难精通，不仅如此还有进阶操作[/b]
先提醒一下：这个游戏的主角不是像其他这类游戏是用空中跳跃，而是冲刺。所以，不要再搞错了啊……

主角可以往8个方向冲刺，就这么简单。这样的操作虽然简单但实际上比二段跳更难操控，但如果操作的好，观赏性比二段跳还要高，而且可以有很多花样在里面。路上的道具比如绿球金羽毛，不仅仅能祝你一臂之力还能在空中刷新冲刺，甚至换地图也能刷新，这点要运用的好。
当然仅仅靠冲刺这招是不能通关的，你也可以直接抓住墙壁并在墙上攀爬（不过这徒手爬墙也太不科学了），但是有体力限制，角色闪红光就说明不能再抓墙上了，但还是可以蹬墙跳。

游戏的进阶操作在后期的BC面才会教你怎么做，但其实这个游戏一开始就可以使用进阶操作，无关存档目前进度，能协助知道进阶操作的玩家更快通过A面。不过进阶操作并不是你会用了就能用得上的，要知道，会用和熟练真的是两回事。
况且，越轻而易举的操作，普通玩家和大神在这个游戏的差距越小。但是大神有一点不同于普通玩家的一点是：[b]他们会在有限的操作上挖掘出无限的潜能，找出普通玩家不知道的操作，并把这个操作精通。[/b]


[h1]难度很合理，并且具有深度[/h1]
实际上，要把硬核游戏做到可以让大部分玩家体验到乐趣而不仅仅只有核心玩家，并不是那么容易。这得考虑到各种问题：比如说关卡难度设计的坡度啊，死亡后带来的负面情绪啊等等。
好在Celeste考虑到了普通玩家大部分的情况，并对此做出了反应：

首先，关卡难度曲线很平缓，至少普通玩家不会很快地被游戏难度所吓倒。这个游戏的一二关并不难，让普通玩家热身一下；从第三关开始，难度开始上升，但A面难度上升并不是太高，并且这个时候玩家已经准备好面对后面关卡了。

然后，游戏里死亡并不会给玩家带来过多负面情绪：死亡之后重开只需3秒（大概吧），迅速的重开可以让玩家不必等待；几乎没有死亡惩罚，不必让玩家担心死亡会损失除地图进度以外的东西；死亡时bgm不会停止，并不会有尴尬的感觉。这应该是玩家们虽然在受苦却又乐在其中的原因吧。

如果这都不行的话……游戏里还内置了[u]帮助模式[/u]，在存档界面开启了就可以通过一些设置来降低难度，比如说你可以把主角改无敌和无限体力，这样你就可以不必害怕那些难过的刺了；又或者你想找刁钻的隐藏草莓可以开无限空中冲刺。不过我认为[b]还是自己打不靠[u]帮助模式[/u]比较有成就感。[/b]

不仅是对普通玩家很和平，对核心玩家也是处处周到：A面之后的BC面，难度和A面对比是急剧上升，有些关卡还需要用到进阶操作，全成就玩家必经的荆棘之路；通关8B后出现的金草莓，也就是一命通关，大神们可选的自我挑战。
[quote=Lilfish14]这是我自己整理的游戏大致全部流程：

1 通简单的A面
2 收集4个水晶之心后去打A核心
（分支：PICO-8（好像是最初版本？）和1up成就）
3 175个草莓全收集
4 打通所有关卡的B面，解锁C面和金草莓
5 肝通所有的C面
（额外挑战：关卡一命通关证明的金草莓……）
大部分玩家可以在10小时内完成1和2，但对于意犹未尽的玩家来讲，仅仅完成1和2就封盘就太对不起这游戏了，得把分支和3 4 5都完成（全成就）才行吧？这样又至少10小时。然后额外挑战，因为这个游戏里一命通关特别难，挑战金草莓的玩家的游戏时长一般在50小时以上，没有上限。[/quote]


[h1]游戏关卡本身就内容丰富[/h1]
首先Celeste的每个关卡的主要的场景设置和机关大不相同，操作机关的方法也不一样：
[list][*]（ps 我只是大致说一下）

[*][b]1关 被遗弃的城市[/b]：主要的机关是你一站在上面或抓住就往规定的路线快速移动的红绿灯平台，不仅可以移动，还可以用它来进行大跳。
[*][b]2关 古堡[/b]：果冻状的星云，对星云冲刺会一直往这个方向冲刺直到冲出星云，并且出星云后会刷新冲刺和体力，但不要撞墙！有追逐战，Badline会跟在后面完全将你之前的操作重复。
[*][b]3关 度假村[/b]：细微触手的地方只能来一次，第一次无触碰时间，之后会长苔藓，有站着会下降的平台，关底有比较长的追逐战。
[*][b]4关 黄金山肴[/b]：风向！后期逆风而行的地图几乎只能靠冲刺前进。有踩上去就往箭头方向移动的方块，如果站在有盖子的那边，还可以稍微控制方块的前进方向。关卡的水球等同于无消耗的冲刺，会给你一点时间选择前往方向。有些逆风地图会有蓝球向你袭来，可以踩。
[*][b]5关 镜之神庙[/b]：关卡整体来说很黑暗。有你一冲刺就快速按轨迹移动的平台，所以要想好什么时间段冲刺。进入红球会一直往方向前进，直到你撞墙或者冲刺强行停止。飞行敌人会向你冲刺，能撞开红墙，但会被光幕挡住，踩掉后会在原地留下记号，复活时在记号处放出冲击波。关底需要你将水晶运到终点，水晶不怕刺和敌人的袭击，但水晶掉坑里会死。
[*][b]6关 水晶山洞[/b]：有一种方块，如果你对它本体冲刺，他会往反方向撞击，会撞开脆弱的墙体。开始出现弹力球，碰到它会被强力弹开，也可以刷新冲刺。关底Badline会做为boss出场，请尽可能碰到她本体。
[*][b]7关 塞莱斯特[/b]：前面的重复前几关的场景和机关，3000米才是重点：会出现往上吹或往下吹的风，一共有30个小旗子，每个旗子都是中继点。
[*][b]8关 内核[/b]：在这关，只有道具和换图才能回复冲刺。关卡风格可以通过机关在冰和火之间改变，所置的机关会因为内容变化而发生改变。
[/list]
每个关卡的机关和风格不同，每关对应的决策也互不相同，这样会让玩家产生新鲜感，有玩下去的动力。

[b]A面每个关卡都有若干个草莓，一个录音带和一个水晶之心。[/b]
草莓是这个游戏的基础收集要素，草莓175个，金草莓25个。草莓大多是在偏离主线的区域，以及一些很刁钻的地方……虽然任何草莓都并不需要用到任何的进阶操作，但有些地方操作需求很高，为了个草莓而挂掉几十次已经不稀奇了。
暂停后关卡下面有一个条目，显示着草莓的获得情况，而且草莓按顺序排列，可以利用这点寻找草莓。

录音带获得后可开启B面。录音带所在地图，伴随着8-bit音乐和红蓝框交互出现，每4拍换一种。获得录音带后会自动传送回安全地点。
水晶之心是开启各面8关的必要物品。水晶之心的获得一般很刁钻但也有意思：前7个A面的水晶之心获得需要解谜，8A 和BC面通关即得。
比如说，[spoiler]第7关3000米有水晶之心，但被封存着，需要6颗宝石解锁（自家梗），前面的6小段都在特殊位置存在一个宝石，全部收集后可获得水晶之心。[/spoiler]

ps：建议先自己尝试着收集，如果实在收集不到再去看攻略。
另外，[spoiler]在6A电梯上方的路有个彩蛋，但想看到需要用到进阶操作。[/spoiler]


话说我玩了这么久[strike]（你连C面都没全部通呢）[/strike]，好像在游戏内并没有找到有什么可以当做缺点的内容，游戏外可以吐槽的也就“为什么这游戏在steam没有售卖原声音乐”的问题了。

总之呢，虽然明知这类游戏并不适合所有玩家，但我还是会把这个游戏推荐给大家。
[h1]相信我，如果你愿意玩下去的话，就知道为什么IGN会给10/10了[/h1]

40341148.review:
Celeste Review
Summary: A 2D platformer that's fun and a challenge, but not one of the best

I was stuck betweeen choosing this and A Hat In Time as the next game to play, but since I haven't played 2D platformers in some time, I went for the former.

In this game, you play as a girl named Madeline who has embarked on a quest to climb a mountain whilst fighting against her inner demons and self doubts, which personifies as a darker version of her.

The gameplay is simple. You run, jump, climb, and also have the ability to dash in any direction. What I like about this game is that every chapter has a new mechanic to play around with using those simple controls. This is good because the game is quite challenging, and thanks to the instant refresh after death, you can try to master it without interruptions thanks to the game's solid controls.

The game also has a simple 8-bit visual design that provides some nice backdrops, and the music is nice and refreshing. However, considering the subject matter it concerns,  the story is quite lackluster. I know what you are thinking, "who plays platforming games for the story?" Here's the thing, the main theme is about believing in yourself and battling doubts, so I wished this, as a story, was better told because something like that could have had potential.

Other than that, there's isn't a lot about the game that has wowed me. It's not that unique of a game and I wasn't really drawn to it fully. But, as a platformer, it plays well, it's fair, and it has some great level design.

Overall, it's good but not amazing as a lot of critics and possibly a lot of users are saying. When you compare this to somethig like Super Meat Boy or Braid or Shovel Knight, it can't compete. I daresay this may be the first indie game to be overhyped by critics. If you are looking for a good 2D platformer, you can pick this up, but there are much more superior indie platforming titles that easily take the crown.

+ Good music
+ Simple, tight controls with cool dash mechanic
+ Good level design
+ Challenging, fair platforming
- Story really lacks depth
- Does not do anything spectacular

Score: 8.0 / 10

Un jeu très exigeant qui rappellera Super Meat boy tout en ayant bien sa propre identité et ses propres idées de gameplay, une difficulté progressive et juste, a quelques détails près (j'y reviens dessous), une histoire simple mais touchante et une musique... oh mon dieu la musique <3

Mention spéciale au dernier niveau qui offre un vrais "best off" de l'ensemble du jeu, aussi bien niveau gameplay que niveau musique : ils te font sentir que ton objectif est là, tout près.

On retrouve ce truc génial des Die and Retry : Ce n'est pas le personnage qui progresse, c'est toi, le joueur ! Tu reviens plus tard sur les niveaux ou tu a galéré et tu est devenue un dieu !

Mais en ce qui concerne mes petits points noirs.

- Niveau 2 : Il faut casser un élément du décors pour avancer, sans que cette mécanique ai été suggérée explicitement par le jeu, c'est très bizzare d'autant que le jeu repose énormément sur cette notion d'apprendre une mécanique avant de la mettre en pratique... inattention de Game Design ?

- Les labyrinthes ... meh, je trouve que ça casse le rythme et j'ai eu plusieurs fois cette sensation de ne pas savoir ou aller... dommage, surtout dans un jeu a tableaux.

- J'attendais un plus grand développement du personnage de Théo 

- Je jouais avec une manette Xbox 360, et on sens que le jeux n'a pas vraiment été conçu pour ces pads qui supportent + de 8 directions, combiens de fois mon perso est allé en haut ou a gauche au lieu d'en haut à gauche...

Mis a part ça ? Foncez, c'est génial !

40314534.review:
The game feels fantastic. Smooth and quick, just how a difficult platformer should feel when you get a level right. However, that excitement fades fairly quickly as you press on. The dialogue becomes really cheesy, interaction between characters is forced and unnatural, and the levels get really annoying. A large amount of thought and care are clearly put into the first 8 story levels, but the other 66% of the levels, known as B-Sides and C-Sides, are considerably less well-made. The level designers take the most frustrating and annoying- sometimes even the mechanics that just dont seem to work like they'd be intended to work- parts of a level and turn them into their own, brand new level. To make it worse, a "runner-up" soundtrack (hence their clever use of the term 'b-side') is slapped on for you to listen to while you spend a considerable amount of time trying to beat them. This is done again for C-Sides, except it's the second worse soundtrack for a level and the mechanics are even more cancerous. It also really starts to look like theyre out of ideas as once they introduce a new mechanic to a B or C-Side it's just thrown everywhere all over the level for you to enjoy.

It starts out strong, but when it was all over I questioned the price considerably.

40284733.review:
[No Major Spoilers, just rambling.]

Gameplay

Celeste Mountain is no easy feet. Celeste wants you to fall, and you just have to get back on your feet and try again. The fundamentals of the game are built up from 3 simple movement mechanics: jump, dash and climb. Together they make the perfect sets of skills that will help you get to the top. They might be simple alone, but together you have some advanced movement abilties that feels rewarding to execute. The levels are laid out in front of you, and it doesn’t take long to figure out how you should effectively maneuver thru them, but doing so is the challenging part. And you can’t even blame the game! 
The movement is fluent, simple and responsive. If you fail, it is your own doing. can’t blame the game for this one bud. The developers actually went out of their way to make the game as speedrun friendly as possible, which is something more speedrun focused games should be encouraged to do. The gameplay is truly were it shines the most, and will be the one of the main reasons you continue playing. It never bores you, it always challenges you with new and exciting abilities, and you keep learning and understand your own capabilities.

Artstyle

We have barely reached the top of the iceberg of what this game has to offer, such as it’s great ambient audio pieces combined with pixel tones which matches perfectly with its cute artstyle. I was kind of weirded out at first by its artstyle, blending a cute cartoony artstyle with pixelart at first sight looks a little off, but it’s done so well in its execution that I can’t even complain. Every gameplay related element is pixel art, this makes it easy to perform pixel perfect jumps, while keeping the visuals simple and easy to follow. Other parts like cutscenes and hub world are more centered to focus on the Cartoony style, which is a lot more expressive than pixel art, so it works perfectly, and adds another charming factor to the game.

Music

The music has a surprisingly similar style of what the artstyle was going for, blending to very different music genres, which is Ambient music with 8-bit tones. This creates a relaxing environment to minimize frustration. I actually had a lot less frustration in the game when I focused on my victories rather than my failures. Anger can make it harder to focus which than makes the game even harder, so try to have a calm head when going in, understand that all your deaths are the building stairs to your victory! So keep on dying!

Story

Typically, games like these don’t have any deep or interesting stories, and they usually rely on people getting hooked on the gameplay. But this game is different. The gameplay seems to have overshadow a really interesting abstract story that I think we can all relate to. The whole game symbolizes our inner problems. Talking about emotions and understanding them is very relevant to the game and the one playing the game, as most people usually give up on these games because they just can’t handle the frustration. I don’t believe you need to be any good at platform ragegames to beat Celeste. All you need is a bag of determination and patience, and with the right mindset it will become enjoyable and failure will barely faze you anymore (though I do recommend having some experience with platformers) We explore these struggles with our main protagonist Madeline who is not a climber, but yet here she is. I don’t want to spoil it for you as the story can be interpreted in many ways.

10/10 I’m not a masochist I swear (；・∀・)

40263437.review:
Celeste is a marvel of a game. It tells a somewhat serious story by being earnest and with a surprising lack of pretention. The story is all framed by a TOUGH AS NAILS 2D PLATFORMER but fear not. Celeste is about facing your problems, learn from them and move on to the top, not punishing yourself further. 

I truly enjoyed Celeste far more than I expected. The controls are smooth and precise. Like other “hard” games you level up but actually getting better at the game. It’s a masterclass in learning-by-doing. When you die you respawn instantaneous and most jump-puzzles are just one screen. You will die, a lot, but that is just a part of the learning process and the game makes no deal at all for failing a task. Try again, fail again, fail better. Reach the top if you can, that is all. 

The design is nice and functional retro. No clutter and sharp pixels. Quite beautiful but clearly not the selling point of the game. Music is brilliant. Also retro but really enjoyable and even gives ques how to clear certain puzzles. 
The characters have their own stories and are all chiselled out and rememberable. Even if the game deals with themes of depression and bad self-image it somehow does this while being charming and not too on the nose (even if you are LITTERARY trying to get over your own problems).

So, a surprize hit for me. Come for the game-play, stay for the story, or vice versa. It’s meticulously well made in every aspect and I have really no complains what so ever. On first completion I felt just that, complete, If only for a short while.

40263030.review:
The Good: 

- Smooth difficulty curve throughout the base game
- Fantastic pixel art
- Beautiful soundtrack
- The narrative is perfect

The Bad:

- Base game is a bit on the short side
- Extreme difficulty spike for bonus levels

With the above points, 90% of the game is covered. Buy this game if you really love 2D pixel art, 2D platformers, an amazing soundtrack, or all of the above. But I want to dive into the narrative for a moment. 

***SPOILER WARNING***





***SPOILER WARNING***






***SPOILER WARNING***




The narrative is extremely well-executed, well-written, and heart-wrenching. The entire main arc of the "Part of Me", culminating in the final two chapters where you battle her and ultimately conquer your fears and become one with her, is a powerful metaphor not just for mental health but for any feelings of fear and anxiety. Conquering that fear, becoming one with that part of yourself, is an extremely healthy thing to aspire to and the game really brings that struggle to life. As someone who struggles with mental illness myself, I found myself relating to a lot of the messages and struggles of the protagonist, and was brought to tears by the end of the game - if only because it reminded me of my own struggles a bit too much.

Like I said, this game is well worth getting, and I hope it tops the "Must Play" lists of reviewers and game journalists for months to come. Not only for its smooth gameplay experience, challenging yet rewarding difficulty curves, and beautiful design work (visual + audio), but for its underlying message. Hopefully it allows people to understand better the human struggle, or at least empathize a bit with their fellow man.

If you're thinking Celeste is "yet ANOTHER pixel art, 2D platforming indie game", then you'd be right. It is. However, even though it's still early in the year, I really don't think there's going to be another game coming out in 2018 that will be as fun and make me as happy as Celeste has. This is actually the second time I bought the game, the first time was on the Switch but I just couldn't shake some weird impulsive feeling that's telling me to go for the Steam achievements. Even though I've alrady collected most of the collectibles on the Switch, Celeste just gives me an uncontrollable desire to replay it from scratch, and what better way to do that than pay yet another $20 for it?

As for difficulty, I haven't really found this to be overtly hard so far. Compared to Super Meat Boy, I've died a heck of a lot less, but some of the collectibles are an insane challenge (along with the hidden levels). There's a ton of content in this game for anyone who likes platforming and collecting things.

40215136.review:
Mi pimer contacto con el juego de Celeste...
En primer lugar le color celeste se refiere a
el brillo de la montaña que debemos escalar.

El personaje femenino al que controlaremos,
quiere escalar la montaña pero sus motivos
no están claros en un primer momento.

Conforme vamos superando capitulos iremos
descubriendo a ciertos NPC's que nos pondran
las cosas complicadas excepto Theo con el que
entablaremos un cierto vinculo de amistad y
nos ayudara.

En el segundo capitulo conoceremos al otro lado
de Celeste,en otras palabras su depresión,con la
que iremos formando otro vinculo de forma que
servirá para desenrañar la razón de porque
queremos escalarla.

LLegados a un cierto punto la historía nos deja
conocer más fondo que esconden y cual es su
verdadera naturaleza para comprender a fondo
el juego.

La protagonista se percata que necesita de su
otra parte para coronar pico y sentirse realizada.

Este juego de corte indie se caracteriza por su
jugabilidad al igual que su narrativa y pixel art.
Lo desarrollaron los mismos que Towerfall
Ascension.

Esta claro que la narrativa es importante en su
mayoría aunque dentro de este género no es
necesario definitiva ni que estuviera tan bien
elaborada.

Ese dialogo en la montaña con Theo esta muy
completo en todos aspectos,llega a transmitir
un compendio de emociones con las que me
he llegado a sentir identificado...sobre todo
con las de Madeleine.

Dejando a un lado el aspecto narrativo vamos
a centrarnos en su jugabilidad...que considero
excelente rozando la perfección.

Podremos movernos con las flechas y ejecutar
un dash seís direcciones hacia todos los lados
y dos diagonales,al principio solo dispondremos
de uno.

Po otro lado la mecánica de escalada,seremos
capaz de ascender y descender a nuestro
antojo a demas de apoyarnos en las paredes
para superar pantallas.

Teniendo ya eso en cuenta el juego cuenta
con un mapamundi interactivo,en el que
podremos ver nuestro progreso actual,
asi como los distintos coleccionables.

Existen una amplia gama de coleccionables:

-Fresa:se consiguen en zonas secretas y de
  dificil acceso,cada area cuenta con un gran
  numero de ellas y como dice el juego cuenta
  sobretodo para fardar con los amigos.

-Cassetes:existe uno por area y desconozco su
  utilidad.

-Hay un tipo de ellos que sirve para conseguir
  más dash,es decir aumentar el número para
  desplazarnos más rapidamente.

-Corazones celestes,hay cuatro a lo largo del
 juego y su uso esta marcado a la hora de entrar
 en una zona mas avanzada del juego...

-Pico8:es un ordenador o pc de sobremesa retro
 que emulará nuestro ascenso final a la montaña
 en forma de minijuego,es un secreto que esta
 esta escondido en el capítulo del hotel.

El género de este juego es claramente plataformero
pero tiene un aire a vieja escuela,muy dificil,duro,
complicado como pocos muchos lo comparan con
Super Meat Boy pero considero que este es único
en su especie.

Un juego con una gran historia,desafiante en todo
momento,dejandote respirar en algunas areas pero
ante todo justo...

Una muy buena alternativa a un juego de su éstilo
su precio es correcto,cuando lo compre no estaba
seguro pero ahora lo aseguro al 100%.

Se me han escapado algunas cosas pero creo que
de momento hay suficiente material para su compra...

Recomendado!!!

40210014.review:
Celeste is a really great platformer. There's not a lot more to it than that. The controls are tight, the challenges are creative, the environments are varied, and each level will pit you against a new gimmick that's around just long enough to be fun without overstaying its welcome. It even has a cute story with some light subtext and an emotionally satisfying payoff at the end.

Most of the complaints I have about Celeste are nitpicks; things like the real-world story about a girl climbing a mountain feeling disconnected from the air-dashing, spike-dodging gameplay, or the slight unevenness of the pacing in some areas. On my initial playthrough I was slightly perplexed to learn that the final chapter could only be unlocked via rare collectibles, something I'd been uninterested in going after since the game made the optional challenges sound truly optional. Going back to grab these after the fact was very forgiving, however, thanks to a generous chapter select that allows you to hop directly into mid-level checkpoints and exit as soon as you grab what you're after. The final chapter also has next to zero story significance, and it's only there as a bonus for those who want more gameplay.

My only *real* criticism is that obtaining some of the special collectibles required for the final chapter is esoteric to the point of absurdity. I'm talking things you literally cannot figure out in game without bringing in external knowledge. One of them makes no sense unless you're familiar with a secret in Super Mario Bros. 3. Another requires remembering a secret from an earlier level (which you might've missed) and noting down the colours of birds in order to plan out specific dash patterns. These kinds of borderline ARG-esque puzzles are fine in isolation, and I'm sure there are plenty of people who had fun figuring them out, but I don't agree with gating off big chunks of gameplay behind them. The people who just want more awesome Celeste platforming action probably don't overlap much with the crowd who love solving puzzles as esoteric as these. Thankfully google is a handy out for the ones you get stuck on, but I still found these puzzles to be immersion-breaking, flow-halting annoyances, especially when discovering that their solutions were things I had no way of figuring out based on the knowledge the game had given me.

Even that complaint is a relatively small one in the grand scheme of things, however, and since there are easy workarounds it's hard to get too hung up on it. It does stand out as a misstep in an otherwise immensely polished game, however.

Celeste is a great example of a game that polishes and iterates upon a solid formula while being a consistent 9/10 in every area, sometimes even going above and beyond. The final level of the main story is particularly worthy of note, providing an awesome emotional climax that meshes with the gameplay elements to create a genuinely gripping experience. While it didn't quite blow my mind enough to shoot straight into my own personal game of the year shortlist, it's hard to imagine any fan of hardcore meatboy-esque platformers not being satisfied with this one.

Whether you're just going through it once for the story or unlocking all the bonus challenges and collectibles, Celeste is just great fun. A work of passion by devs who know what they love, and how to deliver on it.

40200912.review:
[h1]Traumhafter 2D - Platformer[/h1]

Celeste ist ein unglaubliches Spiel für nahezu jedermann. Einzig für Neueinsteiger im Bereich der Hüpfspiele könnte es ein wenig länger dauern, bis das Eis gebrochen ist und Celeste seinen Zauber entfacht. Aber selbst in diesem Fall gilt eindeutig: Es lohnt sich!

Wie für traditionelle Jump´n´Run Spiele üblich, teilt sich Celeste in mehrere Levels mit unterschiedlichen Themengebieten auf. Ein Level umfasst dabei üblicherweise mehrere, in etwa einen Bildschirm umfassende, Abschnitte. Häufig gibt es dabei die Möglichkeit unterschiedliche Pfade zu nehmen und versteckte Bereiche zu entdecken. Jeder Abschnitt stellt für sich eine ansprechende Herausforderung dar. Daher kann es auch mal zum häufigen Ableben kommen. Doch dies bleibt immer frustfrei, da der Spieler unendlich viele Leben hat. Außerdem vergeht nach einem Fehlversuch nur ein kurzer Moment bis man erneut loslegen kann. Der Schwierigkeitsgrad steigt im Verlauf des Spiels angenehm stetig, aber spürbar, an. Jedes Level bleibt dabei aber durchgehend fair. Dies ist enorm motivierend, da man stets vor Augen hat, wie der Abschnitt zu bewältigen ist. 

Eher genre-untypisch gibt es in Celeste eine interessante Story, die von den liebevollen Charakteren des Spiels profitiert. Während man durch die Level voranschreitet wird die Handlung hin- und wieder von kurzen Cutscenes vorangetrieben. Wer sich davon gestört fühlt, kann diese aber problemlos per Pausenmenü überspringen. Man sollte der Story allerdings auf jeden Fall eine Chance geben. 

Neben der Standardversion aller Level, auf denen sich auch die Story abspielt, lassen sich noch sogenannte "B-Side"-Varianten freischalten. Diese stellen nicht einfach nur die normalen Levels mit mehr Hindernissen dar, sonder bestehen komplett aus neuen Abschnitten. Dabei werden die in den jeweiligen Leveln eingeführten Mechaniken durchdacht weiter ausgereizt und kreativ eingesetzt. Der Schwierigkeitsgrad des Spiels steigt mit den B-Sides deutlich an und dürfte auch Genre-Veteranen alles abverlangen. Aufgrund des fantastischen Leveldesigns und den extrem abwechslungsreichen Herausforderungen lohnt es sich aber, sich durchzubeißen. 
Wem das immer noch nicht reicht, darf sich über die C-Sides der Level freuen.

Celeste glänzt durch sein überragendes Leveldesign mit viel Abwechslung und durchgehend fairen Herausforderungen. 
Dabei richtet sich das Spiel nicht nur an Jump´n´Run Freunde, sondern auch an die, die es werden wollen.
Wer an anspruchsvollem Gameplay Gefallen finden kann, wird mit Celeste großen Spaß haben.

10/10

40198461.review: 关卡设置过于恶意，不推荐

40187795.review:
不知不觉已经玩了89小时，写写我心目中Celeste的精妙设计与瑕疵。
[url=https://cowlevel.net/game/Celeste/review/3024624]图文并茂版[/url]

[h1]1.难度[/h1]
Celeste能满足从手残玩家直至超级大神的不同需求。

我感觉Celeste的难度曲线已经很平缓了，手残多花点时间就能通关，不会有很强的挫败感。如果玩家还觉得难的话，游戏内置了“协助模式”，有多个降低游戏难度的选项——无敌、无限体力、多一次冲刺/无限冲刺、游戏速度减慢10%/20%/30%/40%/50%。通关后感到意犹未尽的玩家可以继续收集草莓、挑战B面C面。

此外，Celeste对硬核玩家也是一场盛宴，它的关卡设计与进阶操作是为速通量身定做的。速通之外，还有金草莓的收集（即各章节的一命通关）。我全成就花了20小时，剩下的全部时间都花在收集那25颗金草莓上。


[h1]2.收集要素与关卡设计[/h1]
每一章有若干草莓、一张B面磁带和一颗蓝心，内容丰富。

不查攻略收集全部草莓是一种享受。每颗隐藏草莓在地图上都有明确提示，不像某些游戏，找隐藏全靠蹭墙。在主菜单，每一章被分成了几段，每一段都记录了草莓的收集情况，按顺序进行排列，因此我可以利用这一点去找草莓。譬如说，我之前在第七章1500米处漏了两颗草莓，通过前后草莓所在位置进行排查，最终把目光锁定在唯一的一张图上。虽然Celeste给玩家的印象是坠落即死亡，但我还是向地面的缺口纵身一跃，底下果然有隐藏房间！有人可能会疑惑，这TM也是好的设计？其他的坑跳下去就死，偏偏这个坑底下有隐藏房间？是的，游戏已经通过草莓的排序给了足够的提示，我也不是每见一个坑都跳下去试试。第七章2500米处最后一颗草莓也有异曲同工之妙，因为倒数第二颗草莓已经在关底，搜索范围非常小，所以这颗草莓我是靠蹭墙找到的。

蓝心的收集也蛮有意思的。第二章梦醒后我登上塔顶，看到蓝心被封印，旁边有一则诗，提示玩家要在梦中到达这里。而在梦中试图登上塔顶的过程中，玩家进一步加深了对游戏机制的理解，因为要用到高级技巧：切换场景时刷新冲刺。第四章的蓝心玩的是超级玛丽3的梗，在白色方块上蹲5秒即可进入游戏背景。

第三章打扫旅馆那一段，总共有三条岔路，每条岔路结尾处有“洗衣机”，激活后便会将同颜色的脏被单清理干净。然而，沿途中的脏被单却是平台跳跃的落脚点，每清理一批被单，关卡的难度也随之提高。三条岔路选择的顺序不同，会有不一样的游戏体验。第三章的蓝心则是被脏被单封在房间里，需要玩家清理完被单后原路返回，在开头处取得蓝心。

Celeste在B面C面的关卡中逐渐教会玩家一些高级技巧：蹭墙跳、下蹲向前冲刺、冲出虚空的一瞬间可接跳跃等。还有一些则靠玩家自己领悟：墙角跳、不耗体力爬墙、斜向下冲刺接跳跃等。带着丰富的知识储备再去看A面的关卡，能找到许多“意想不到”的捷径。

抛开高级技巧不谈，Celeste对游戏机制的发掘也很深透。弹簧、虚空、泡泡和弹力球，在为玩家提供助推力之外还有一个很重要的功能，那就是刷新冲刺。在第六章中，弹力球还作为用羽毛飞行时的障碍出现。在所有章节ABC面中，我最喜欢的是5B，首先音乐就好听到没话说，其次它是唯一一个非线性结构的B面。最重要的是，5B踩怪兽和扔水晶那一段太让人惊艳了，让我产生了“还能这样玩？”的感觉，以下几种深挖的游戏机制相互交融着——悬空状态下踩怪兽刷新冲刺、勾引怪物撞开红砖墙、利用怪物复活时的冲击波震碎红砖墙/获得向前的动能、举起水晶时人物会保持之前的动能（可以扔出水晶，然后向前冲刺接住再扔出去，这样能把水晶扔得很远；抑或是扔出水晶再斜向冲刺接住，能爬上扛着水晶时上不去的墙）


[h1]3.一些吐槽[/h1]
C面让我十分失望。我个人觉得C面可长可短也可以很难，但必须有趣。本可用我前面所说的高级技巧和深层的游戏机制，创造出精妙同时具有难度的关卡，然而C面则是通过拼凑片段强行延长关卡长度、增加死亡与试错成本、增加操作难度降低容错性这种把戏为游戏画上了句号。5C是最恶心的，与最精彩的踩怪兽扔水晶没有半毛钱关系。好在我继C面之后还挑战了金草莓收集，不然会有种虎头蛇尾的感觉。

为什么OST不在steam商店卖啊？反正我是跑到bandcamp去买了。第八章冰与火的背景音乐不一样，由基本旋律分别加上幽寂的风声、炽热的岩浆声齿轮声组成。如果能像节奏地牢那样就更好了，分别为冰与火写两套更具特色的音乐，比如说冰用Chiptune火用摇滚。

真没什么可吐槽的了，哈哈。

40179343.review:
If you even like platformers enough to be looking at this review right now you should get this game. 

Well after having just completed the core story part of the game I couldn't contain my need to praise this game. I will be putting this with the modern greats of platformers amongst Spelunky and Hollow Knight. From a gameplay perspective this game is excellent. The core of your mobility is simple and versatile and as you progress thoughout the game new "gimmicks" are introduced at a perfect pace. And I hesitate to say gimmicks because they are such wonderful map based mobility that perfectly synergize with your base kit and are most importantly fun. This game knows exactly how to create fun. It is very difficult in a fair way. The maps are such that you can be endowed with great mobility and still be challenged and every single iota of content in the game they asked how can this be more entertaining. The best way I can descirbe the game play is it becomes quickly evident what you are meant to do then I find myself laughing and smiling at my failure to do so as I die over a thousand times. And if this game only had the game play I would love it. But what made this an ethereal journey laced with ecstacy is the excellent story to go along side it. It is one of my favorite stories of any medium and it has dialouge that will make you laugh and maybe cry as well depending on how hard it hits home. It's story is such that your emotional investiment in the characters makes you need to complete the game for them more than for yourself. All of this coupled with beautiful pixel art and charming painted pictures throughout make this game nearly perfect. Ireally couldn't say anyhting bad about this game. 
You never abstract noot sounds could carry so much emotion.

40173675.review:
Overrated average 2d platform with an interesting plot.
Celeste is not a bad platform, but it's definetly not the 10/10 overwhelmingly positive masterpiece everyone claims it to be.

The game consists of climbing a mountain, what you have is a long series of linear screens to complete, every chapter introduces some new mechanics, some are cool and interesting ("phase" blocks, feather ...) others not so much (wind, bouncing blocks ...), there are collectables and secret areas to find with different unlockables. All is stiched in with an plot about depression and the climbing of the mountain as the simbol of overcoming it, there will be some plot twists but nothing jaw dropping, overall it was an interesting original take on the genre but it's more of a character development over time than a proper story.

Where the game suffers is primarly the levels themselves, they went for a hard, die a lot but respawn fast approach, this meant that every screen is extremely small with only a couple of jumps to reach the end, they are too much segmented stopping your movement just when you start feeling the flow, you don't have the feeling of actually climbing a mountain or overcoming a big danger like in super meat boy, shovel knight or classic super mario games, the only exception, and when the game is at its best, is during the "bosses" sections where you have to clear longer paths.

Also the pixelated artstyle is way too repetitive, yes, every chapter introduces a new color palette, but until you reach the next one every screen looks the same, there's really nothing interesting to see until you unlock the next area everytime.

If you really crave for a new challenging 2d platform then get this, otherwise I wouldn't recommend it.

40142450.review:
This game is very fun if you're into masochistic 2D platformers as much as I am. It's kind of like Super Meat Boy where you play many individual small areas at a time and whenever you die you immediately get set right there at the beginning of that area. So dying doesn't feel like a setback as opposed to a learning experience. I never felt frustrated dying because every time it was like "oh ok, so that's how to do it" or "why in the world did I dash up instead of right?" So all the deaths feel like they're your fault and not the game's. 

It felt satisfying to get to the top of the mountain at the end and in my opinion this was easier than Super Meat Boy but not by a huge amount, so if Super Meat Boy was too much for you then you may not like this game. It's also easier than Cuphead which is a better game in my opinon. I would also say it's easier than the fantastic Ori and the Blind Forest (at least the original edition that is.. the enhanced version apparently nerfed the uber difficult boss escapes because of outcry that they were too difficult), but it's definitely a difficult game so check out Celeste on sale to see if it's for you and return it if it isn't. In a sea of "meh" platformers that get released all the time I look for the greats among them and this sets way above the pack right up there amongst the best of them as one of the most fun 2D platformers of the last few years. The epic music later in the game as you're dodging the "boss's" lasers throughout the level where you confront yourself made me yell "This what I'm talking about!" confirming that this is something special and I'm convinced you'll have this feeling too if this is your thing.

The only time this game genuinely made me mad was during the B side levels and even then it was still fun. Definitely buy this game if it's on sale.

40139773.review:
One of the best and most complete platformers ever made. Everything about it is perfect, including the heartwarming story that it manages to tell about its main character Madeline. Her story is so relatable and warm, and fits nice and snugly with all of the tight difficult-but-fair platforming in the main story, but even after you've finished that the challenge keeps going as the B and C sides of each level are wonderful extensions of all of the game's various level mechanics. Having experienced and completed all of these levels, some of them taking 900+ deaths for one chapter, the feeling of accomplishment when you finally finish a screen on that 901st try is super addicting. The music also deserves special mention, it is so perfectly fine tuned to be relaxing and tense when it needs to be. The main story's soundtrack is more dynamic to the changing environment and story sequences, whereas the b-sides are more jamming tunes that loop painlessly while you die forever on whatever challenge before you. Both sets of music are incredible.

I am going to miss this game so much now that I'm done with it, I eagerly await any expansion they make to it. Even after 37 hours I want more. I can't praise it enough.

I had been keeping an eye on this for a while, since I'm a bit of a sucker for a good hard platformer. From everything I saw prior to the game's release, I knew it was going to be fantastic. When I got my hands on it, I realised it is actually better than I anticipated with every aspect of the game having a ridiculous level of polish and attention to detail. It is obvious how much love went into making this game.

With regards to performance, everything ran extremely smoothly with no stuttering or crashes.
The story is great too, with memorable characters that are easy to care about. There is a lot of content to play through. I thought I finished it all probably two or three times, but there was always more to play! The music and sound is also fantastic.

I really didn't go into much detail at all on each of the aspects, but the whole game really does scream quality.

[h1]Regarding Achievement Hunting[/h1]
Unlike many other difficult platformers, there are no achievements requiring zero death runs or speedruns of levels despite that challenge being a feature of the game. This makes the overall 100% easier, since you don't need to worry about how long it takes you to beat content. However, the game is still difficult, and it will take you quite some time to get through all of the content.

40132894.review:
[h1][b]I haven't felt this in love with a game in a long time.[/b][/h1]

It's a GOTY on my list and the year's just begun.

I'd grant it even just with how well it handles its themes alone, but it helps that it has some of the tightest 2-D platforming controls to date, along with brilliantly designed levels and extremely satisfying environmental mechanics, that shine even brighter in the far harder stages. 
Along with a beautiful hi-bit aesthetic, endearing characters and incredible music, it never became a frustration simulator that similar games such as Super Meat Boy or VVVVVV inevitably had me feel.

What makes the deal even sweeter is that this game never lets up with teaching you, there are so many additional speed-tricks hidden in the deceptively basic controls, and the game always makes sure you know exactly what you need to before giving you the next challenge. 
Even after having finished the main story, you're introduced to new tools that prep you for the post-game content, and hohoho boy, does this game do content in a way that AAA long forgot. Y'know... With us in mind as people rather than wallets.

I'm [b]heavily[/b] biased to praise its story because of how it reflects a lot of feelings I'm personally battling at rock bottom right now (as well as just being an indie/pixel-art fan in general), so it resonated with me to an extreme.
But I can't remember the last time a game had a sequence that drove me to finish it with such determination that I only hit the hay at 4 in the morning. And the emotion-rousing OST had no small part in that. 
(Lena Raine (the OST composer/artist) uploaded both the official OST and B-Side collab remixes to her own YT channel, go grab an earful, highly recommended!)

I actually felt genuine heartfelt joy for the adorable Madeline with every triumphant step I helped her take near the end. For a game to elicit something like that out of me I'd say requires a particular sort of brilliance.

[b]This game made me feel a little bit of happiness again.[/b]

Keep climbing that mountain.

40132373.review:
Гора Селеста - виртуальный Эверест. Убивающий пиксельных человечков. Портящий нервы игрокам. Ломающий клавиатуры. Сюда пришла Мэдлин. Молодая девушка, не похожая на скалолазку. Её мотивы - неизвестны. Чем Селеста так опасна - неизвестно. Ну что ж, давайте подробнее рассмотрим эту гору.

Перед нами самый что ни на есть классический представитель жанра платформеров. Упор здесь ставится на прыжки и карабканье и движется игрок преимущественно вверх. Мэдлин - не Лара Крофт, которая с помощью ледоруба может висеть на скале бесконечно, и она владеет таким параметром как выносливость, не позволяющая ей долго висеть на скале, что заставляет игрока действовать максимально быстро и с минимумом движений. Также есть такая особенность как рывок, и использовать её можно лишь один раз в полёте. Если только на уровне нет кристаллов, дающих дополнительный рывок. Это заставляет не только учитывать скорость прохождения, но и внимательно продумывать маршрут перед тем как прыгать.

Гора состоит из 8 разных зон, у каждой из которых уникальная механика. Большинство из них это знакомые матерым игрокам в платформеры движущиеся платформы и странная убивающая героиню слизь, но среди них есть место и оригинальным идеям. Таким как, например, особо запомнившимся мне блокам, которые при запрыгивании на них начинают атаковать. Каждому элементу отведена своя глава, и за её пределами они не используются, за счёт чего ни одна механика не приедается. Но всё же мне не до конца понятно данное решение разработчика. И без того интересная и разнообразная игра могла бы стать ещё более интересной, будь в ней грамотное сочетание всех пройденных отрезков пути.

Второе и, пожалуй, самое важное достижение Celeste - ее дружелюбность. Её не просто можно пройти, плюнув на сбор обязательных для каждого платформера коллекционных вещичек, её можно пройти вообще не напрягаясь. Для этого для неподготовленных игроков здесь есть так называемый режим помощи. Режим этот из себя самый настоящий набор читов на случаи, если вам слишком сложно: бесконечные выносливость и рывки, бессмертие и регулятор скорости игры. В этой игре не стыдно быть казуалом. При этом игра, в отличии от Furi или Cuphead, не накладывает никаких ограничений: все собранные предметы засчитываются независимо от того прибегали вы к помощи или нет. Это решение выглядит немного странным, но стремление разработчика сделать игровой процесс и получение достижений максимально безболезненными для нервов и клавиатуры заслуживает как минимум похвалы. Я не советую включать этот режим ценителям хардкора, но я не советую отказываться от помощи тем, кто хочет не только и не столько страдать, сколько наслаждаться сюжетом. А наслаждаться есть чем.

Селеста - не просто высокая гора. Это гора, материализирующая человеческие страхи. А Мэдлин - не крутая девушка, которая ищет экстрима. Она живой человек, со своими проблемами и переживаниями, победить которые можно только взобравшись на вершину. В игре не так много диалогов, но каждый отлично работает на раскрытие героини и привязывание игрока к ней. Сколько платформеров, в которых хочется сопереживать главному герою, вы можете назвать?

Прохождение уровней здесь - это не просто прыжки туда-сюда. За счет грамотного сочетания идей геймплея и сюжета в игре создаётся чувство, что ты словно идёшь к вершине, держась за руку с героиней, где с одной стороны Мэдлин, которая пытается преодолеть свои внутренние страхи, а с другой - игрок, который пытается пройти ЭТОТ ДОЛБАНЫЙ УРОВЕНЬ. Я не помню когда в последний раз видела в играх такую мощную связь геймплея и повествования.

И я крайне рекомендую забраться на гору как ценителям жанра, так и просто любителям хороших историй. И в идеале проникнуться Селестой и как качественным платформером, и как хорошей историей. Эта игра подарила мне мощную и неожиданную эмоциональную встряску, и, возможно она сможет подарить её и вам. Подниматься под мотивирующую музыку, смотря как показатель высоты увеличивается с 500 м до 1000, 1500, 2000 и т.д. ещё никогда не было так больно и приятно одновременно.

40131327.review:
To call Celeste an incredible game would be an injustice.  Celeste is an experience.

As an avid fan of 2D retro platformers, I was initially wary of this title as I've heard about it's unforgiving difficulty, and I typically stay away from rogue-like games.  But, after seeing all the positive reviews, I decided to give in and glad I did.  The game is gorgeous, with plenty of secrets to find, mechanics to master, heart felt story and charming characters.  And the soundtrack is incredible.  Just as I thought, Celeste is brutally hard and unforgiving where you will die repeatedly until you finally overcome it's incredibly challenging levels.  Dying over and over again and learning from those deaths and mistakes is part of the experience, but eventually you'll find yourself getting better and more proficient with the platforming.  This game demands perfection.  But instead of feeling daunted by this, I found myself wanting to come back and try again.  Yes, this game is hard, but also incredibly fun.  

I loved and hated Celeste, but in the end, this was truly one of the best games I've played.  I really can't rant and rave about this game enough.  Do yourself a favor, and experience this gem.  Big thumbs up from me!

40109286.review:
Celeste truely is one of THE BEST 2D platformers out there period!

I intially picked it up on Nintendo Switch but just needed to buy a 2nd copy on Steam to show my support because it's such a mastapiece in every sense of the word.

Celeste took aroundabout 8-12 hours give or take to finish the 7 story chapters during my Switch playtime, which included doing 2 of the more hardcore optional set of levels and trying to hunt down every strawberry I could (ended with aroundabout 140/180) so lengthwise the game is pretty decent in terms of a single playthrough, not touching much of the bonus content but that's only just scraping the surface.

The pixel art is gorgeous, the regular art is a beaut to look at, the soundtrack is godlike and the gameplay is buttery smooth, challenging all the way through and simply is just really fun to do.

The gameplay is entirely built around simple moving, a climbing system similar-ish to Zelda:BOTW and a 8-directional dash, doesn't sound like much but ever stage is constantly implementing and seemlessly teaching you about new mechanics and entirely new ways to use your old abilities in ways you never even considered.

And on top of all that there's tons of strawberries to collect, plenty of extra hardcore remix stages with even more godlike music and even some others I won't spoil here. Exploring is greatly rewarded and you are encouraged to do it often, though sometimes it can hover on the 'well how was I supposed to know that???' with some of the more hidden collectibles.

Even the story, the goddamn story of a 2D platformer about a girl climbing a mountain is an emotional experience that most people can probably relate to on atleast some level. I saw plenty of myself in Madeline and it made me just that much more determined to climb my way to the summit.

They spent years making this game and it shows.
Absolutely a must buy for anyone looking the general direction of 2D platformers.

40078835.review:
This is honestly one of the best games I have played in a long time and I love it a whole lot.

Celeste pushes every mechanic as far as it possibly can, constantly finding new and unexpected uses and combinations, such that every screen feels like a fresh new challenge.

Almost every secret in the game rewards you with more gameplay, be it a one-screen platforming puzzle for a strawberry, or a harder, "B-Side" version of a world, which makes exploring feel so much more worth it.

The soundtrack is incredible, the visuals are beautiful and polished, and the story was unexpectedly great.

This game didn't need to do any of these things to be a fantastic game but it did them anyway and I'm so happy for it.

I went into this game expecting a platforming game with screen puzzles and the like, I took a real jump since it costs a lightly larger than nonsignificant amount and I hadn't seen more than a stream of it, playing chapter 3.
What I got was far better than expected, extremely solid platforming and fun story that kept me wanting to see where to go next.
I thought the game would be finished after the main story, but the B-sides and C-sides are great as well as speedrunning the game. (The inbuilt speedrun timer is great for someone like me who is not a real speedrunner, just a wannabe)
The final summit climb was beyond fantastic and made me really love the game, thematicly awesome and the revisit during the B-side was even better.
The game has nice touches, being able to find the PICO-8 game in stage and play it was super cute and fantastic.

This is the kind of game that challenges you and makes you feel great when you complete something, gets the dopamine blasting.

Overall, loved it, still haven't done all the B-sides, got the C-sides to look forward to as well as getting 100% otherwise
Can't think of anything really wrong with it, overall fantastic
9.98/10 because I can't find real faults, other than not being able to scroll upwards to go to the bottom of the menu (please fix thanks)

40066415.review:
[h1]不是因为山在那里，而是因为那里有山。	[/h1]
很多人描述这款游戏，会这样告诉你——“我为什么要攀登上那座山？因为山就在那里。”但我要告诉你，这是完全的错误，只是一句名言的不当引用、一种误用。山一直在那里，无可撼动，但那座山只是恰好在那里，无论那里是什么，是沼泽，是深海，是炼狱，都无所谓，只是那里，一定是某个明确的地方，某个你想到达的地方。
“山在那里。”这是冒险者的宣誓话语。
“那里有山。”是发现者的命中注定。

[h1]我为什么要登上那座山？[/h1]
这座山（塞莱斯特山）有着太多的秘密，太多的奇迹。它高耸入云，气象多变。挑战它的旅途存在着似乎无尽的磨难，甚至有不少冒险者在此身亡。幻觉、幽灵、密语、古迹……其他更坏的，更危险的，更激动人心的，更壮观的一切都可能在这座山上发生，并且随时可能发生。
那么我（Madeline）为什么还要登上这座看似不可征服的山峰，为什么在不断地重试中挑战不可能的故事？

保持呼吸~保持呼吸~

因为我，迷失过。曾几何时，每一个人都曾想过自己存在的意义，自己所做的每一个行为对于这个世界的影响，每一个过错所犯下的罪孽，每一个善行所带来的回报都是否值得……所以我才来到塞莱斯特山的山脚（石碑上写着——“谨纪念那些，为登山事业献出生命的探险家”）为了向着山顶前进。没有什么特别的理由，只是想证明自己，证明自己在漫长的人生中并非一事无成，并非混混度日，并非被懒惰与愤怒所荼毒......
因为我能够做到。

[h1]山里的他们和山里的“我”	[/h1]
古怪的山中老妇人，另一个寻找山中古迹的冒险者，一个幽灵旅店的店主，这些就是小小人公Madeline在山中遇到的人们，也是山中冒险的见证者、参与者、引导者。
我不会详细的告诉你们关于他们对于主人公的帮助或者指引，因为这些都将由你们自己在游戏中去细细体味。他们会在山的某处等着冒险者的到来，也会在山的某处给予冒险者一臂之力，或是勇气，或是启迪与坚定。
但本该只有的这些人中，混入了不该出现的人...或者说“存在”...一个与主人公外表一模一样，只是多了些许的堕落，多了些许的罪恶，多了些许的愤怒与诋毁的，由山中神秘力量所幻化而成的“存在”。一个象征着每一个人懦弱的负面性格，一句句催人放弃的恶毒言语，对于内心的考验，对于目标坚定的考验。

如果将山中遇见的人们（或幽灵）比作一种中立的物象，那么由山中力量所幻化出来的“我”则代表着邪恶的具象，到底应该如何解决她，故事会告诉你一切。

[h1]抑郁少女的自我救赎之旅	[/h1]
塞莱斯特山存在着多少秘密我们不得而知，但这趟攀登之旅无疑是值得铭记的。当一个人因生活的不如意或变故而产生各种心理时，便容易引发抑郁，所有的负面情绪随时可能喷涌而出却无处宣泄。所以Madeline选择了攀登，选择了一个前往的目标。
倒不如说这一整个山峰都是Madeline内心的真实写照——危险又漫长的关卡，另一个自我的不断阻挠，一次又一次的失败重启，暗中不断追求的那一颗颗草莓和旅途最后的终点……这是Madeline不断超越自我的象征，也是不断鼓起勇气面对自我的见证。
整个游戏中最令我震撼的场景并不是Madeline最后终于登上了顶峰，而是，在山脚下，她与另一个自我的和解，并且终于脱下了背包的重担。

“我们一起从这里爬出去吧！”Madeline如此说着。
这是最为简单的话语，同时也是对于另一个自我的最为善良、容易的和解。

当Madeline解下背包的一刹那，我可以确实的感受到这款游戏所蕴含的深刻寓意，也就是从那一瞬间起，故事确实可以脱离讲述者的言语，向着内心深处直击而去。

[h1]终言：	[/h1]
比起这款游戏的难度这一噱头，我确实更在乎其对于剧情的表述与演绎，所以从上文表述内容来看我并没有对于关卡设计和音乐美术等方面做确实的点评。综合而言，我都相信IGN给这款游戏的10/10评价非常的贴切，因为这款游戏非但达到了我对于它的所有预期，甚至在各方面都有所超越。这是我在之前完全没有预料到的，今年最值得一玩的作品给我的震撼。

在很早以前，我曾幻想这样一个场景——我再一趟列车上不断前行，起点与终点被明确的标记在地图两端，但我却永远也不会到达。在名为前方的铁轨上，听着耳内不断循环的悠扬乐曲，就这样，一直下去。
但现在，我更希望到达终点，不在乎前方所有的一切是否符合自己的期待，是否让自己后悔。只是向着前方，对自己不再有所亏欠，给自己一个完整的旅行。

[h1]我为什么要登上那座山？因为那里有山，而我不想逃避。	[/h1]

40065375.review: 我被魂3虐出了斯德哥尔摩综合症，所以当我连介绍都没看完，只是看到“死上百回”的字眼就毫不犹豫的入了。然而打开游戏才发现并没有怪物可打，什么翻滚到身后背刺，什么盾反都是不存在的。介绍并没有欺骗我，这个游戏真的很难，对操作和反应的要求极高。推荐给喜欢挑战自己、能从连续的失败中品尝到快感的动作类游戏ドM尝试一下。对于我们这些普通玩家来说，即便通不了关，也可以学习到一个人生的道理：一个妹子去冰山上摘草莓，真的是作死xD

40064794.review:
I really enjoyed playing Celeste, I'm down for try-hard games.
Every level got me saying "how the fuck did I whine about last level?!" 

The end, actually getting on top of the mountain was awesome, how music went low and you'd hear the wind. How you'd become so nervous and die to things you'd laugh about the last level. It was kinda hard to get adjusted, all life using arrows + WASD.
Now arrows + ZXC, sometimes would get them mixed and kms unintentionally. (oh boy, if I told you how many strawberries I lost that way)

Now let's get down to the critique.

[b]POS:[/b]

- I think the most "hard" part of the game comes from getting collectibles, strawberries will get you killed left and right.

- I think that's the charm of this kind of gameplay method, it's hard so it feels rewarding when you finally get to conquer it.

- B-sides are fun and teach you more complex and rewarding mechanics that'll help further in the game.

- Loved Theo, he's bae. He's funny and caring and personally I don't know why do you get the option to ignore him and sleep. Personal bonding over difficulties is pretty awesome.

- Loved the inclusion of the original game as an easter egg, same for the achievement from beating it. (it was hard! D:)

- Actually came here for Inlovewithaghost if you've a change, give them a try. (: 

- The mechanic to learn the new "method" every level is funny and doesn't force you to repeat a long part.

- Does that mean the learning curve is actually okay?

- I heavily dig 8/16bit artstyle, so I liked it, it's very colorful

- When Madeline starts "growing" as a char, she becomes relatable, as well as "a part of her", she was also one of my favourite characters.

- Actually gives you some advice about life, don't fight with yourself, don't blame yourself, you're all a team, with pros and cons, that could be worked on, improving your life. Love yourselves guys (:

[b]CONS:[/b]

- Story and Madeline character take way too much time to actually progress.

- I even disliked her for being so stuck up. (And that might be a problem for most if you don't interact more with the NPC's)

- It was until you rescue Theo that her char starts up growing into you. (at least into me) And that's half of the game.

- Sometimes controls won't work properly whilst on Keyboard dashing you into oblivion when you wanted to go up, etc.

- Mr Oshiro deserves more development, man, he was a dude so dedicated to his job, he actually haunts it after his death, he's got potential, outside from being a "boss" and a insecure dude. (also frick that level, frick that level in particular)

- The special assist is too much, imo. (At least you'd try enabling them by "up, up, down, down, left, right, left, right, 
dash, jump, enter), if you don't care about strawberries, tapes and crystal hearts, you mostly won't need those.

- I think character design could be improved, they looked awesome in "cutscenes" and those square character thingies, but in gameplay.... we could get a face or at least some dots and a smile, nostalgia shouldn't be a synonym of plain.


If you want charm, a warm fuzzy feeling game, and a gud challenge, you'd try it!
I personally enjoyed it very much and became a lil bit better in touch with myself.

Don't give up!

40064380.review:
FOR SPEEDRUNNERS

If you can repeat intricate jump-and-run patterns with pixel resolution and sub-0.1 second accuracy, then this game is for you. You'll have hours of fun fine-tuning your way through the numerous mazes, traps and riddles.

However, if you (like me) are just that normal guy who stumble and worm their way through such contraptions, Celeste is more likely to be a tedious experience. Often it takes ages to complete a single screen - and there are lots of them. You need to make a dozen right steps without a single error to get to the exit. If you do make a mistake it's from the start all over again -  which can grow old quickly if you do the umpteenth repetition on the fifth screen in a row.

Another point is that the background story - which starts off very nicely and seems to provide an intriguing touch to this game - turns pretty absurd rather quickly. If this game is a metaphor for real-world struggles, maybe it's not the best idea to veer off into overly fantastic realms so forcibly. 

Not my cup of tea.

40038121.review:
Celeste is an astonishingly good game. That's really all you need to know. 

Rarely have I ever seen such lovingly crafted level design executed to perfection. At its core, Celeste uses its heartfelt and groundbreaking story about overcoming your doubts to reward you, the player, as you and Madeline triumph over a mountain that is both literal and figurative. As many other reviewers have noted, this game doesn't punish you for failing (and you will fail, soooo so many times). But it takes great care to instead encourage and celebrate you when you finally succeed. Not only is this game damn fun, it's also wholesomely gratifying in a way that is rare and difficult to describe. 

My only small complaint is that midway through the game there is a level with no strawberries and it feels slightly empty as a result, but understandably this level drives the plot more than anything else. 

Do yourself a favour and buy this game. It captures everything that makes video games enjoyable. 

I want to finish this review by commenting how appreciative I am of MattMakesGames for truly focusing on the heart of what makes gaming great - in both Towerfall Ascension and Celeste, the beautiful pixel graphics and astoundingly good music serve as a mere template for a core concept of brilliant old school gaming with flawlessly balanced challenge, accessibility and that extra magical ability to drive you to push yourself to the edge of your skill and capabilities. I hope the success of this game fosters more titles from this studio. 

I cannot wait for more titles from this developer (a sequel to either game would be fantastic, and please Matt make the original dozen Towerfall levels able to use 4 players and not just 2).

40033378.review:
Incredible. My favorite game in a while. I had been going through a stretch where most games just weren't appealing to me. I kept hearing about Celeste and then a streamer who I watch mentioned that they might play it soon, so I wanted to try it for myself before watching someone else play it. I'm glad that pushed me to get it. 

The platforming is so satisfying. The music and atmosphere is great. The story is nice and never really had the preachy moment that I was expecting to happen. The difficulty is perfect. I kept waiting for it to get frustrating to the point that it wouldn't be fun anymore. It came close a few times, but masterfully walked the line where all you want to do as the player is keep trying. I'll resist making the comparison to that certain other game series, but the deaths in Celeste always feel fair and always teach you something. 

These past years I've paid just about zero attention to retro style pixel games. I'm glad I played this one. I just finished the story after 8.5 hours and I'm glad there are the B-sides and apparently other content that I will unlock when I collect a few more things. 

It's been a long time since I'd think about a game during the day and look forward to getting back to my PC and making some progress. This was the perfect game when I felt like maybe I was losing interest in gaming in general. I imagine I will put at least another 8 hours into it if not much more. I finished with 128/175 strawberries and haven't tried too many B sides yet. 

I can't really think of anything negative to say. Maybe a few levels where the twists added to the gameplay weren't my favorite, but nothing horrible.

40033169.review: One mountain, one girl, and a bunch of climbing puzzles. I am a person that really doesn't love games that constantly use the same format but just gets increasingly harder *cough* getting over it *cough* and I went into this game thinking it would be the same. But I was pleasantly surprised by the amount of complexity that came with each level and the challenge that was difficult but not impossible. This was a game that caused me to improve and grow as I moved along. After I finished the game, I went back to finish puzzles I skipped or missed and found myself breezing through them. On top of amazing gameplay, the music in this game is amazing. It adds to the atmosfear that can cause uneasiness and also amazement. To accompany music is a wonderful, heartwarming story of a girl trying to escape herself that raps up into a beautiful package of a game. Overall, the most brilliant platforming game I have ever played.

40032235.review:
I have to say that I really enjoyed my time playing this game, brilliantly designed and challenging raw platforming and nothing else with bosses being chases as opposed to fights.

 My first any% completion of the game took 7.5 hours though there is more content in the form of 175 collectible strawberries which sounds very tedious but is actually fun as most of the strawberries are behind other challenges. There is also another final level after the main story which is certainly a greuling test and if that isn't enough there are "B-side" levels which are finger-breaking nightmares with massive satisfaction for each room you clear, each chapter has one and they each take about 2 hours to complete and up to 800 deaths.

 The story really good too, though it can be a little vague (especially with the antagonist) but any question will get answered.

If you have had any enjoyment out of platformers or any sort of "git gud" style game then it is worth a buy, though if you want a vast amount of hours for your money then it may be good to steer clear.

40031849.review:
[h1][i]"นั่นล่ะ แมดเดอลีน หายใจเข้า เธอต้องทำได้"[/i][/h1]

กำลังมองหาเกมท้าทายให้ตัวเองอยู่หรือไม่? เกมที่ตายหงส์ตายห่านบ่อยๆเฉกเช่น Dark Souls อะไรเทือกนั้น
 ขอแนะนำ Celeste เกมผจญภัยสุดโหดหินต้อนรับปี 2018


*** จอยจำเป็นอย่างสุดซึ้ง ***

Celeste เป็นเรื่องราวของ แมดเดอลีน ผู้ผ่านเรื่องยากลำบากมาอย่างมากมาย เธอต้องการค้นหาตัวตน เธอจึงตัดสินใจที่จะปีนสู่ยอดเขาเซเลส ภูเขาในตำนานที่มีพลังอำนาจครอบงำจิตใจสร้างความวุ่นวายภายในใจผู้คนและดึงตัวตนที่แท้จริงของคนเหล่านั้นออกมาสู่โลกแห่งความจริง

เกมเพลย์เป็นแนวแพลทฟอร์มที่จะต้องปีนป่ายตามกำแพงเพื่อผ่านฉากไปเรื่อยๆ คล้ายๆกับ Super Meat Boy แต่มีฉากที่หลากหลายกว่า หลักๆตัวเอกจะสามารถ กระโดด dash กับไต่กำแพงได้ เวลา dash ผมของเธอจะเปลี่ยนจากสีแดงเป็นสีฟ้า การเกาะกำแพงอยู่ได้เพียงชั่วคราวเท่านั้นพอเราทนไม่ไหวตัวจะกระพริบเป็นสีแดงและจอยคุณจะสั่นระริกเป็นเจ้าเข้า มองโดยรวมวิธีการเล่นอาจดูเรียบๆง่ายๆ แต่การจะเล่นให้ผ่านนั้นยากโข

นอกจากจะพยายามผ่านแต่ละฉากแล้ว ยังมีความท้าทายอีกอย่าง คือการเก็บผลสตอเบอรี่ ซึ่งมันเก็บยากเอามากๆและไม่ได้เป็นปัจจัยสำคัญอะไรกับเกมนอกเสียจากเป็นเพียงแค่คะแนนโดดๆไม่ได้ช่วยอะไร เหมือนเกมสะสมแต้มดาดๆทั่วไปแต่ก็มีแรงจูงใจเพียงพอที่จะทำให้คุณสละหลายร้อยชีวิตเพียงสตอเบอรี่ผลเดียว ด้านงานภาพถือว่าไม่แตกต่างจาก TowerFall ซึ่งเป็นสไตล์ของ Matt Thorson เพลงประกอบเอาไปเต็มสิบ เป็นอีกเกมที่เพลงประกอบดีงามมากๆ

[u]จุดเด่น[/u]
- เวลาตายแล้วเกิดใหม่ไวมาก
- เกมแม่งสมูทชิคๆ
- สไตล์ภาพอันเป็นเอกลักษณ์
- เนื้อเรื่องที่ไม่ซ้ำซากทั่วไป
- ช่องทางลับมากมายซ่อนอยู่ตามฉาก
- อาจะเหมือนเกมแพลทฟอร์มทั่วๆไป แต่ใช้เทคนิคเยอะ
- ระบบนับจำนวนครั้งการตายและ timer สำหรับจับเวลาในการเล่น
- เกมมี Assist Mode ไม่ว่าคุณจะกากแค่ไหนก็ตาม จะสามารถปรับให้สเตมิน่าไม่มีวันหมด หรือ dash หลายครั้งก็ยังได้ แต่สำหรับการเล่นครั้งแรกไม่แนะนำให้เปิด เพราะจะสูญเสียความสนุกของเกมไปอย่างมาก

Celeste คือเกมสำหรับเกมเมอร์สายฮาร์ดคอชอบความท้าทายกับเหล่าขา speedrun ด้วยเนื้อหาที่เข้มข้น มากด้วย secret เพลงประกอบโคตรดีย์ เรียกได้ว่านี่คือหนึ่งในเกมแพลทฟอร์มดีที่สุดอีกเกมนึง ที่แม้ซื้อราคาเต็มก็นับว่าคุ้มค่า

40031249.review:
If you want to play this game the way it's meant to be played, then you had better enjoy masocore games, because unless you're some kind of god, the difficulty eventually escalates to that point. That said, Celese is not a rage-tier game. There's no RNG bullshit, no hidden variables, and the controls are - if not intuitive - completely consistent in their response. I think I've died three times feeling it was the game's fault, but so far, I've died over 4500 times, and 4497 of those, I felt like it was my fault for making a mistake.

In other words, it's a very fair game. Also, if masocore itsn't your bag, the game has "assist mode", which allows a pretty fine-grained control of the difficulty. If timing challenges are a pain, then you can slow the game from anywhere between 90% to 50% of full speed, in 10% increments. You can also turn of fall deaths and damage from obstacles, the depletion of stamina (a mechanic that limits how long you can hold onto walls, climb, and walljump up instead of out), and even increases the number of times you can dash in the air, from 1, to 2, and then infinite.

Enabling every asist option to the maximum makes the game impossible not to beat, even for a young child without much coordination. Though ndividuals with significant biological or neurological issues might still difficult, I think that it makes the game *literally* as accessible as this sort of game can possibly be without compromising level designs. 

One thing that has caused "hardcore" gamers some umbrage is that using assist mode does NOT disable achievements. I don't really care, because, hey, if I had nerve damage that made normal difficulty impossible, I'd want to get the achievements so long as I tried my hardest - but you might have a different opinion.

In terms of difficulty curve, Celeste requires a moderate amount of skill even at the first (real) level, but this is offset by the fact that the game is cut into small rooms. If you die in a room, you respawn in that room. Additionally, levls are cut into chapters, so if you want to leave one level so you can go back to a previous one to polish your skills, and gain collectibles, your progress isn't entirely erased: you can go to the most recent chapter. The game uses visual language to tell you when you've reached a new chapter - in the environment, a large autosave icon is chisseled into a wall. If you see this, then you're guaranteed to be able to choose to rtespawn there.

Celeste has three sets of levels. A sides, B sides, and C Sides. A sides are where the story of the game lives, along almost all of the collectible items. B sides (unlocked via a collectible in A Sides) are uniformly harder than the hardest A side level, and each level contains only one (impossible to skip) collectible, tied to an achievement. I have not yet unlocked the C sides, but youtube videos and 30 hours of gameplay experience lead me to believe that they'll be about as hard as a rage-tier masocore game (though more fair, because C sides DON'T contain any RNG-based mechanics) - expect them to demand high-speed, nearly pixel-perfect precision. C Sides are unlocked by completing all A Sides and B Sides.

The music for this game is excellent, and it conveys the atmosphere of the level and the main character's mood well. It's a soundtrack that I consider good enough to buy on its own merits, but musical taste varies between people, so I can't say if that will be true for you. If nothing else, nobody being honest with themselves will be able to say that the music is bad on a technical level (eg, missed notes, broken chords, bad timing, poor melody), even if they don't like the style in which it was composed, which is synth-heavy with a side of classical orcestration.

The story was... small scale? It's a game about a normal person with normal problems climbing a weird mountain. Don't expect global consequences or epic scope. Or, really, answers about the "mystery" of the mountain - while you'll definately learn "what" is up with Mt. Celeste, you never learn "why" or "how". That said, the character interactions are if not the most gripping I've ever been exposed to, adequate and realistic.

Overall, it's a game worth playing, and paying for. I don't regret that I bought it at the undiscounted price.

I'm always very hesitant when trying a new platforming game as I think I have very high standards when it comes to this genre. The fact that Celeste has a $20 price tag also made me reluctant to buy it. After playing a solid 20 hours I can happily call it an incredible game and recommend it to anyone with even a passing interest in platforming games.

Probably more than any other platformer I've played, Celeste adds mechanic after mechanic that just feels fun. I found myself constantly saying "oh that's cool" or " yoooo that screen was sick!" and the gameplay/level design really needs to be commended. As with last years The End is Nigh there is a puzzle element to the game, which is even stronger here, and the game really rewards being observant and thorough. The Mirror Temple is my favourite world/chapter/level in any platforming game period and is an absolute joy to play through.
The diverse soundtrack also deserves a mention for some amazing tracks and, as is becoming more common, is implemented into the game fantastically. Having the music rise and fall as you proceed through the chapters just adds that extra layer of enjoyment and helps push you through the challenging segments.

The difficulty with a platforming game is the main factor in whether a lot of people will enjoy it or not and I would say that the main story should be approachable and challenging for most people but the extra content may be a bit much, if you got through Super Meat Boy you'll be fine with this. To say much more would ruin a fun and satisfying experience, definitely not a platformer that you want to spoil for yourself. Get it.

Wow, Celeste gehört mit zu den besten 2D Jump 'n Runs, die ich je gespielt habe. Und ich habe so ziemlich alles gespielt.

Die wenigen Spielmechaniken (Sprung, Airdash und klettern) werden schon in Welt 1 bis ins kleinste Detail ausgereizt und alles ab Welt 2 haut einen dann einfach nur noch aus den Socken. Auch wenn das Spiel nur aus kleineren 1-Screen Herausforderungen besteht, sind die Levels dennoch ziemlich ineinander verwoben, was einem das Gefühl gibt, auch ein bisschen zu erkunden und nicht nur Screen um Screen durchzugrinden. Das Leveldesign ist genial, Pixelart ist wunderschön, der Soundtrack abwechslungreich und der Schwierigkeitsgrad sehr hoch.

Was die Story angeht, so lege ich in dem Genre ja absolut gar keinen Wert drauf, wurde aber auch hier positiv überrascht. In der Geschichte von Celeste geht es darum mit Depressionen klar zu kommen und auch ums Mensch sein im Allgemeinen. Das Ganze wird so unbeschwert erzählt, dass es wirklich Spaß macht, zu lesen. Einziger Kritikpunkt ist, dass sie halt irgendwann nach 6-8 Stunden vorbei ist.

Danach gibt es aber noch jede Menge zu tun. So gibt es wie bei Super Meat Boy eine Dark World für jede Stage und 175 Erdbeeren zu sammeln, wobei jede für eine optionale Herausforderung steht. Daneben gibt es noch kleinere und größere Puzzles, sowie noch mehr streng geheimen Sammelquatsch.

10/10

40006920.review:
A huge, beautiful, brutal platformer with blinding polish and a difference in philosophy:  it wants you to beat everything it's got, because [i]you[/i] can do anything.  That's what the story's about, that's what the game itself is about -- channeling all the fractured, doubting parts of oneself, compressing the dissociated, gaseous will into a beam of hot plasma that can burn through the barrier of the impossible and open a tunnel to the golden land of victory.  [i]Celeste[/i]'s message is empowerment through sweat, and the change that comes over us when we embrace, rather than evade, the difficulties of life.

This is a game that's worth hundred-percenting.  I did it without ever activating assist mode, and though I died nearly 9,000 times, I never once felt I couldn't conquer an obstacle.  Even a string of 500 deaths in a row could not shake my confidence and drop me into a rut of nervous failure, and I owe that to the game's uniquely uplifting atmosphere.  It would not surprise me if playing [i]Celeste[/i] pulled some people out of depression.  

If you play 2D action games at all, this is an essential addition to your Steam library.   

(Changing Madeline's hair color to show how many midair dashes she has left is a brilliant idea!  And have you ever played a game that doesn't teach you how to perform some powerful techniques until the end?  They were so simple, I'm surprised I didn't pull them off by accident earlier!  Ingenious!)

This will be a game that i'll come back to just to play for fun, it can get challenging later on but it all seems fair.
